channel.title: Pentecost on Sermon Archives
channel.description: Recent content in Pentecost on Sermon Archives

item.title: The Man Who Didn't Care
item.description: This is a 1995 Penecost sermon that I found on a 3.5 inch floppy disc. I was able to convert it to ODT and PDF format.

item.title: The Man Who Didn't Care
item.description: This is a printed and highlighted sermon from 1992 from Pentecost. It is highlighted with yellow higlighter. This is the 150th sermon that I have uploaded to this site.

item.title: Love Builds Bridges
item.description: This is an undated, printed and highlighted sermon that does indicate a date in the church calendar, but not a date. My guess is that it’s from the 1990s given it was printed from a computer.

item.title: For Those in Church
item.description: Here is a Pentecost sermon from 1978, handwritten in blue ink with yellow highlights.

item.title: Something Missing in Religion
item.description: Here is a handwritten sermon from 1975, written in blue ink with highlights in red pencil. It mentions that it is also Stewardship Sunday.

item.title: What We Know
item.description: This is a typed Pentecost sermon from November of 1996. It mentions that he has spent a lot of time waiting recently in waiting rooms and for phone calls. Since it was preached at Emmanuel Lutheran Church in Seymour, the congregation would have been aware of his cancer diagnosis at the time.

item.title: Ready and Waiting
item.description: This is a typed Pentecost sermon from 1993 with yellow highlighting. It was preached on November 14, 1993, likely at Emmanuel Lutheran Church in Seymour, WI.

item.title: Getting Down to Basics
item.description: This sermon is a homecoming of sorts. It was a handwritten sermon that was preached 1978 to the congregation where he grew up!

item.title: What We Cannot Borrow - St. Stephen Farewell Sermon
item.description: This sermon comes from the farewell service from St. Stephen Lutheran Church in Wausau. Video is available!

item.title: God And His Tenants
item.description: This is a handwritten sermon from October of 1978.

item.title: Who's In Charge?
item.description: This is a sermon which has both scanned pages and text available. It was preached in October of 1996.

item.title: It's Not Easy Being A Landlord
item.description: This is a sermon from October of 1996 for the Pentecost season. It appears to be a sermon given around the time of the annual stewardship campaign.

item.title: FOR GRUMBLERS, THE BREAD OF LIFE
item.description: This sermon was preached at Emmanuel Lutheran Church, as a part of a “Polka Service” featuring music by “Jerry Voelker and His Jolly Gents”.
